problem_text: b) (A. Lubotzky, A. Shalev). For a finitely generated pro-p-group G set a_n(G) = dim_{F_p} I^n/I^{n+1}, where I is the augmentation ideal of the group ring F_p[[G]]. We define the growth of G to be the growth of the sequence {a_n(G)}_{n∈N}. Is the growth of G exponential if G contains a finitely generated closed subgroup of exponential growth? O. V. Mel’nikov
answer: b) Not necessarily. Let G be the Nottingham group over F_p. The growth of c_n(G) := log_p |G : ω_n(G)|, where {ω_n(G)} is the Zassenhaus filtration, is linear, so by Quillen’s theorem the growth of G is subexponential. But G has a 2-generator free pro-p subgroup (R. Camina, J. Algebra, 196 (1997), 101–113) with exponential growth. (M. Ershov, Letter of 19.10.2009.)
